column2: FUNCTION : TENDERING AND CONTRACTS ROLE : Head Of Department  Tendering & Contracts DESIGNATION : General Manager REPORTING TO : Director  Operation Industry- Real Estate & Contracting Preferred Industry- Construction Contracting Company PURPOSE OF THE ROLE 1. Accountable to generate business to achieve the turnover target set by the management with respectable profit margins. Plan for the spillover of business for subsequent year in order to achieve higher targets. Venturing into different sectors to find new business opportunities. To groom subordinate colleagues to take up higher level responsibilities. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Department Work Planning & Review - Assign the tender working to the team members based on the work scope. - Guide the team members on Site Survey Work. - Review of tender working and provide appropriate guidance about the items impacting the offer. - Review of the key techno-commercial terms and conditions & factoring them while working of OHP - Review of the resource planning proposed to be deployed for the project. - Coordination with clients and Consultants during techno-commercial negotiation meeting. - Review of Project Specific Presentations to substantiate project construction methodology. - Finalization of the contracts with client. - Internal Kick off Meeting & Handing of Contract Documents to Execution Team - Review of tender enquiries expected during the month and quarterly plan. - Review Pre-Qualification Documents 2. Review of Tender Working - Plan the submission of tender with team member as per dead line. - Review of tender study, Major BOQ, Scope of work & Area Statement - Review of techno-commercial queries raised for Pre-bid Meeting. Attend the meeting as required. - Review of bought out item enquiries floated to various vendors. Suggest any additional vendor - Review of all backup rates taken for tender working. - Review of Rate Analysis to correct appropriately as required. - Review of Detailed working of Over Heads. Decide on the profitability expected from the project. - Review of the techno-commercial conditions and offers after post bid meetings. 3. Vendor Development - Identify new specialized items incorporated in the tender. Prepare a list of manufacturers/suppliers/dealers/associates/subcontractors. Discuss with them and enlist them - Search and develop additional vendors for various bought out items to increase the data base and to bring competitiveness in our pricing. 4. Planning & Review Meeting - Discuss on the Planning for site survey work and provide guidance on the basis of previous experience in the region. - Discuss with the team on any specific or critical requirements of the tender. Consideration of its impact on the pricing. - Discuss and Advice on the vendor list for floating of bought out item enquiries. - Plan for the tender submission i.e. tender working, techno-commercial pre-qualification documents and resources planning with project specific presentation. - Coordinate for the arrangement of Tender Security to be submitted along with tender. - Discuss with Finance Dept. on the critical commercial conditions and impact on financial cost. - Discuss with Safety & Quality Team for any additional specific requirement specified in the tender. - Discussion on receipt of enquiries likely to be issued during fortnight. - Review and follow up with client and Consultants on the bids submitted for further course of action. 5. Enquiries & Submitted Bid Management - Check and discuss with Business Development Team about the likely enquiries to be issued in the coming week. - Check on the team member for take up the assignment. Accordingly direct enquiry received to the person concerned. - Evaluate the received enquiries on the basis of pre-qualification requirements and value of the work. - Maintain the submitted tender list and keep the status update. Projects not awarded the documents are kept in store room and then disposed off. 6. Awarded Contract Management - On award of the project a complete copy of tender document and all the related correspondence till date of award is made. It is Handed over to Execution Team at the time of Kick Off Meeting - Review of Presentation for Internal Kick off meeting. - All the original documents of the awarded tender is maintained in designated folders with hard as well as soft copy for any reference during execution of the contract. List of all awarded tender is maintained. - On completion of the project the documents are kept in the store room maintained for a period of five years and then disposed off. Soft copy is maintained in the completed project folder for future reference and use. List of tenders kept in the store is maintained. 7. Reports Preparation - A format is prepared to keep update on the tender status. The report compromises tenders under working, tender under consideration, status of award of work and likely enquiries in coming month. Every week the report is updated as per the progress on each tender. - Presenting in the quarterly management meeting the Business Plan for the subsequent quarte and review of the achievement of the last quarter. - Report of the perspective Clients is prepared for the complete year. It is divided in four quarters The flow of enquiries in monitored based on the data generated from various sources. 8. Team Building - Systematic Procedure is established in the department. It is easily adaptable to anyone working on the tender. Time to time it is updated. - Daily close interaction with the team for building up their confidence and are able to work independently. - Training on new application used in the tendering is given so that it helps building their ability. - Guide them from time to time on specific and critical requirements of the contract and how to counter them in our favour. - Guide them on the expectation from contractor by Client/Consultants. KEY DELIVERABLES / PERFORMANCE MEASURES 1. Team Building 2. Achievement in Quarterly Business Plan (Plan vs. Actual) 3. Meeting Yearly Targeted Business Plan with acceptable level profitability. 4. Addition of New Clients & Consultant for New Business Opportunities. 5. Addition of Business in New Sectors with JV or other means of qualifications. KEY CHALLENGES 1. To stand up to steep market competition with acceptable level profitability. 2. Sectorial growth across industry will be a challenge to fetch business. Requirement of construction of each industrial sector differs from another. Pre-qualification becomes a challenge and opportunities are limited. 3. Strong networking to have Consistency in Flow of Enquiries so that ample opportunities are available to achieve the quarterly / yearly business plan with spillover for the next year. IDEAL CANDIDATE FOR THE ROLE Knowledge 1. Sound Technical Knowledge to understand project requirements and item specification. 2. Understanding of Contractual Terms & Conditions and its impact on bid. 3. Project Viability study & Decision Making 4. Knowledge of Client / Consultants requirements in the project and capability to address the same. 5. Innovative Ideas to Construct 6. Understanding of Economy to rightly focus the specific industry in boom. 7. Well versed with Computer Software like MS Office / AutoCad. Excellent in Excel. 8. Pool of Vendors for Bought out / Specialized Items for competitiveness in pricing. 9.  Good Command over English Language and ability to convince Client / Consultants. 10. Knowledgeable in Item Rate analysis & Direct & Indirect Cost. 11. Ability to take the decision during contract negotiations. Skill 1. Presentation & Communication 2. To understand Item intricacy for rate analysis 3. Quote the tender with understanding of BOQ. 4. Negotiation 5. Deal With Client & Consultant 6. Strong & balance in decision making 7. To act as ambassador of the company and market for business. 8. Written Communication (Correspondence) 9. Analytical Thinking 10. Bought Out Item / Specialized Item Vendor Development Interested candidates can email their updated resume at wasim@hrworksindia.com or message on 9209078939

column2: IT Contracts Manager typically involves overseeing the creation, negotiation, and management of contracts related to IT products and services within an organization.      Heres a breakdown of the responsibilities typically associated with this role:          Contract Creation and Review    :        Draft and review contracts related to IT procurement, services, and vendor relationships.      Ensure that contracts accurately reflect the terms negotiated and comply with legal and regulatory requirements.      Collaborate with legal counsel and other relevant stakeholders to finalize contract terms.          Negotiation    :        Negotiate contract terms with vendors, suppliers, and service providers to secure favorable terms and pricing.      Advocate for the organizations interests while maintaining positive vendor relationships.      Resolve any disputes or conflicts that arise during the negotiation process.          Contract Management    :        Maintain a centralized repository of contracts and related documents, ensuring that they are organized and easily accessible.      Monitor contract performance and compliance, tracking key milestones, deliverables, and obligations.      Coordinate contract amendments, extensions, and terminations as necessary.      Ensure that contracts are renewed or renegotiated in a timely manner to avoid disruptions to IT services.          Risk Management    :        Identify and mitigate risks associated with contract terms and vendor relationships, such as financial, legal, or operational risks.      Develop contingency plans to address potential contract-related issues or disruptions.          Vendor Relationship Management    :        Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors, serving as the primary point of contact for contract-related matters.      Address vendor concerns and inquiries regarding contract terms and performance.      Collaborate with vendors to resolve issues and optimize contract value.          Compliance    :        Ensure that contracts comply with internal policies, as well as external regulations and industry standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, SOX).      Stay informed about changes in relevant laws and regulations that may impact contract management practices.          Financial Management    :        Track contract expenditures and ensure that costs remain within budgetary constraints.      Identify opportunities to optimize contract spending and improve cost-effectiveness.          Stakeholder Communication    :        Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders, including IT teams, procurement, legal, finance, and business units, to gather requirements, provide updates, and address concerns related to contracts and vendor relationships.
column11: Procurement, IT services, Vendor relationship management, Compliance, Contract management, HIPAA, Legal, Financial management, Vendor, Risk management

column2: Role & responsibilities   As Head  Contracts ; Commercial, you will play a crucial role in developing strategies, managing contractual relationships, minimizing risks, maximizing revenue, and ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. This position requires strong leadership skills, strategic thinking, and the ability to effectively navigate complex contractual and commercial issues. Responsibilities: 1. Commercial Strategy and Planning: Develop and implement commercial strategies aligned with the organizations goals and objectives. Collaborate with EPC ; O&M partners and other departments to develop pricing strategies and competitive proposals. 2. Contract Management: Develop, implement, and manage contract policies and procedures. Review, draft, and negotiate contracts with clients, vendors, suppliers, and partners. Ensure compliance with contractual terms and conditions. Monitor contract performance and enforce contractual obligations. 3. Risk Management: Identify potential risks associated with contracts and commercial activities. Develop risk mitigation strategies and implement appropriate controls. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of risk management initiatives. 4. Project Management and Project Controls: Collaborate with EPC ; O&M partners and other departments to finalise the project schedule, budgeting and cost management. Manage stackholders expectations and resolve conflicts as they arise. 5. Negotiations: Lead negotiations with clients, vendors, suppliers, and other stakeholders. Resolve disputes and conflicts through effective negotiation and mediation ensuring favourable terms and conditions while protecting the organization's interests. 6. Team Leadership: Provide leadership, guidance, and support to team members. Foster a collaborative and results oriented work environment. Preferred Experience: - 20+ years of experience in the field of tendering, contract management and project management of large EPC Projects of Conventional Power Projects, Infrastructure Projects, Hydrocarbon Projects. - Experience of negotiating and administrating the contracts with Customer, OEMs/suppliers and service contractors during pre-award and post-award stage. - Ability to navigate and resolve legal issues arising from tender independently. Person should be legally sound to take a fair independent position without falling back again and again to legal department.  - Experience in various internal processes & system, project schedule, budgeting & risk management processes. - Understanding of basic financial principles and business metrics.
column11: Contract Management, commercial strategy, tendering

column2: The role of a project manager on real estate and construction projects can vary from one project to another        The consistent responsibility of a project manager is to ensure for an on-time and on-budget end result      Before construction begins, the project manager maybe responsible for site selection and due diligence, securing zoning and entitlements, selecting project team members, and creating a schedule and budget; which will lay the foundation for the rest of the project      Once the project is underway, the project manager is the owner s representative on-site, and it is their job to ensure the project is being built to the owners specifications      As the project progresses from planning to execution the project manager will shift their focus to scheduling contractors, processing payments and managing change orders      While some organizations seek a team of multiple managers with various experience and project responsibilities others may go in for a singular project manager      Construction and real estate projects require the expertise of managers who have complete knowledge about the real estate and construction process, recent and relevant experience as well as the ability to work in teams      These certified professionals should have excellent interpersonal and communication skills because they will be called on to make tough decisions      For the smooth execution and completion of any construction project, it is very important for project managers to understand how to handle the different stages of the project accordingly      The role of a project manager during real estate and construction projects is to ensure the successful completion of the project is on time and within budget      Although the project scopes, size and location may change, one thing is consistent; ensuring the timely and cost effective completion of projects      Responsibilities and Duties Once the project is underway, the project manager is the owner s representative on-site, and it is their job to ensure the project is being built to the owners specifications      As the project progresses from planning to execution the project manager will shift their focus to scheduling contractors, processing payments and managing change orders      While some organizations seek a team of multiple managers with various experience and project responsibilities others may go in for a singular project manager      Construction and real estate projects require the expertise of managers who have complete knowledge about the real estate and construction process, recent and relevant experience as well as the ability to work in teams      These certified professionals should have excellent interpersonal and communication skills because they will be called on to make tough decisions      For the smooth execution and completion of any construction project, it is very important for project managers to understand how to handle the different stages of the project accordingly      Qualifications and Skills Project managers often hold a bachelors degree in management, business or a related field, as well as professional certification and extensive related experience      Some project managers obtain a post-bachelors certificate or a masters degree in project management
column11: Project Manager Construction, Change management, Due diligence, Site selection, Project management, Focus, Marketing collaterals, Scheduling, Representative, Budgeting

column2: Contract Manager involves overseeing contracts for inspections, focusing on both profitability and customer satisfaction. The Contract Manager is responsible for the entire lifecycle of contracts, from planning and issuing documents to monitoring performance and ensuring accurate data entry into legacy systems.           Key Accountabilities               1. Contract Oversight:     - Manage contracts for inspection activities, ensuring compliance with legal and company requirements.   - Focus on optimizing profitability while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction.     2. Contract Lifecycle Management:     - Oversee the entire lifecycle of contracts, from initial planning completion.   - Develop and implement effective contract management strategies.     3. Document Issuance:     - Issue all necessary documents and instructions for the proper execution of contracts.   - Ensure that contract terms and conditions are clearly communicated to relevant parties.     4. Financial Management:     - Work to optimize contract profitability, including cost control and revenue generation.   - Collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate invoicing and financial tracking.     5. Performance Monitoring:     - Monitor the performance of contracts throughout their lifecycle.     6. Customer Satisfaction:     - Prioritize and ensure high levels of customer satisfaction throughout the contract period.   - Address customer concerns and proactively identify opportunities for improvement.     7. Data Entry and Recordkeeping:     - Ensure accurate and timely data entry into legacy systems.   - Maintain detailed and organized records related to contract activities.     8. Stakeholder Communication:     - Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders   - Provide Technical Recruiting Team with the specific requirements to engage vendor inspection and field expediting services.   - Foster positive relationships with clients, contractors, and other relevant parties.     9. Risk Management and Continuous Improvement:     - Identify and mitigate risks associated with contract performance.   - Evaluate and improve contract management processes.             Education         Bachelor s Degree in Management Engineering or Economics               ?       Qualifications         - Practical experience in contract management, procurement, or a related field. The number of years of experience may vary based on the positions seniority.   - Familiarity with the Energy industry in which the contracts are being managed is often beneficial.   - A solid understanding of contract law principles is important for interpreting and negotiating contracts effectively.             Competencies         ADDRESS THE WAY - Have a big picture of different situations and reinterpret it in a perspective way     BUILD NETWORK - Forge trust relationships, across departments, and outside the organization     EARN TRUST - Take everyones opinion into account and remain open to diversity     CLIENT INTIMACY - Embrace internal and external client needs, expectations, and requirements to ensure maximum satisfaction     MAKE EFFECTIVE DECISIONS - Structure activities according to priorities, actions, resources and constraint     MANAGE EMOTIONS - Recognise ones and others emotions and express and regulate ones reactions     PIONEER CHANGE - Actively embrace change and benefit from the new circumstances     PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT - Promote commitment by keeping promises as a Role Model     THINK FORWARD - Capitalise on experiences and translate them into action plans for the future

column2: As an MEP and architectural SME Manager at ZURU Tech, you will play a vital role in bridging the gap between different departments, both within our global team and internally in Kolkata      With over 12+ years of experience in coordinating, Tracking, Managing complex projects and some understanding of architecture      You will be responsible for ensuring effective communication and collaboration across all interfaces, particularly within the MEP department and interface between different departments      Tracking and managing all the activities of team members, reviewing their assignments and making sure of it s completion on time                          Interface Coordination:    Manage and coordinate interfaces between various development teams, including software development (Product Owners & Developers), product development (PD), Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), and the manufacturing unit. Ensure a smooth product development process for any product or part of the building.            Design Integration:    Collaborate with SMEs in the design team to seamlessly integrate architectural aspects into the overall project design, maintaining a balance between aesthetics, functionality, and project requirements.            Powerful Communication:    Act as the primary point of contact for the global team and various departments, providing regular updates on project progress, addressing concerns, resolving conflicts, and identifying and closing loopholes in a timely manner.            Risk Management:    Identify potential risks related to interface issues and proactively work to mitigate them, ensuring adherence to target schedules.            Quality Assurance:    Implement quality control processes to maintain the highest standards in architectural design and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.            Project Documentation:    Maintain detailed records and documentation of interface-related activities, ensuring all decisions and changes are well-documented.            Budget and Schedule:    Collaborate with project management to monitor and control budgets and schedules related to interface management.            Innovation:    Continuously seek opportunities to enhance the efficiency of interface management through the implementation of best practices and innovative solutions.            What are we Looking for?                    Bachelor s or master s degree in Civil, mechanical, Electrical or Architecture or a related field.          Minimum of 12+ years of experience in architecture, with a strong background in real estate, infrastructure, or consultancy firms with similar work.          Familiar with interpretation of building or product standards (preferably internationally)          Proven experience in interface management and coordination in complex projects.          Strong knowledge of architectural design principles and construction processes.          Excellent communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.          Proficiency in project management software and tools.          Knowledge of relevant building codes, regulations, and standards.          Leadership and team management skills.          Problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.                What do we Offer?            Competitive compensation      Annual Performance Bonus      5 Working Days with Flexible Working Hours      Annual trips & Team outings      Medical Insurance for self & family      Training & skill development programs      Work with the Global team, Make the most of the diverse knowledge      Several discussions over Multiple Pizza Parties

column2: PriMove Infrastructure Development Consultants Pvt. Ltd. is looking for Water Conservation Expert to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Education:    Graduate or Post Graduate in Civil / Environmental Engineering                  ?       Experience:    Minimum 15 years experience in Watershed Management / Ground Water Resource Management, implementation of Soil and Water Conservation Structures, knowledge of ongoing Government (GoM & GoI) schemes run by Soil and Water Conservation Expert      ?       Tasks         Assessment and Analysis: Conduct assessments of water usage patterns and identify opportunities for conservation and efficiency improvements. Analyze water consumption data, infrastructure, and practices to identify areas of waste and inefficiency.     Development of Conservation Strategies: Develop comprehensive water conservation strategies and action plans tailored to the specific needs and challenges of different sectors, including residential, commercial, industrial, agricultural, and municipal. Identify priority areas for intervention and set achievable conservation targets.     Public Awareness and Education: Raise awareness about the importance of water conservation and the benefits of sustainable water management practices. Develop educational materials, campaigns, and outreach initiatives to engage and empower individuals, communities, businesses, and organizations to adopt water-saving behaviors and technologies.     Policy Development and Advocacy: Advocate for the development and implementation of policies, regulations, and incentives to support water conservation efforts at the local, regional, and national levels. Collaborate with policymakers, government agencies, NGOs, and other stakeholders to promote the adoption of water-efficient practices and technologies.     Technology and Innovation: Stay informed about emerging technologies, innovations, and best practices in water conservation and efficiency. Evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of new technologies such as water-saving devices, efficient irrigation systems, and wastewater reuse technologies, and promote their adoption where appropriate.     Water Audits and Efficiency Assessments: Conduct water audits and efficiency assessments for residential, commercial, and industrial facilities to identify opportunities for water savings and efficiency improvements. Provide recommendations for upgrading infrastructure, retrofitting equipment, and implementing water-saving measures.

column2: The Client Solutions team designs custom spaces, ensuring alignment between sales promises and delivery. They bridge Sales and Product, managing technical customer interactions.     Ideal candidates are Project Management Professionals or Architects with architecture, engineering, or construction backgrounds. They should understand industry best practices, enjoy customer interaction, and excel in technical selling. Strong knowledge of building design, interior fit-out, construction, MEP, and technology is essential. The role requires a willingness to learn, clear communication, and discretion with sensitive information. Candidates must collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders to develop creative solutions.         Roles and Responsibilities:         Perform high-level requirement analysis without external consultants to support fast-moving sales cycles.     Quickly flag risks, develop solution options, and align with internal stakeholders.     Identify potential impacts on project budget, schedule, and quality using knowledge of WeWork products.     Recognize physical or system infrastructure impacting deal negotiations and solutions (e.g., demolition, minimal impact changes, hazardous materials).     Manage due diligence during sales, develop feasible layouts, understand lease terms, and optimize estimates and initial budgets.     Document and communicate custom requirements and design solutions to the design and construction team for proper execution.     Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing workload to meet timelines.     Maintain reporting data for projects and report to upper management as necessary.     Collaborate across departments to implement new initiatives and meet targets.     Conduct site walk-throughs with potential members to showcase standard offerings and solutions.     Regularly visit sites to monitor progress and perform quality checks.     Act as a key client-facing member, working closely with Sales, Product teams, and D&B partners.         Education and Desired Qualifications:         Bachelors degree or higher in architecture, engineering, project management, or building management.     4+ years of AEC experience, including 2+ years in project or design management for corporate interior fit-out, high-end retail, or hospitality projects.     Experience collaborating with design and procurement teams.     Client interaction experience, including participation in meetings for corporate fit-out, IT, AV, Security, and MEP services.     Preferred experience with enterprise companies (e.g., Fortune 500).     Understanding of project budgeting and scheduling; effective client communication.     Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.     Resourceful problem solver, quick learner.     Proficient in Revit, AutoCAD, and drafting software.     Proficient in spreadsheet, Excel, Airtable, or other data management systems.     Strong time management skills; able to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.     Positive influencer with a professional demeanor, reliable, detail-oriented, and eager to learn.

Strong knowledge of mechanical/electrical/life safety engineering and coordination.     Substantial experience in commercial construction projects.     Proficient in reading building MEP/architectural plans for layout and cost assessment.     Quick decision-making and problem-solving skills.     Understanding of construction contracts and agreements.     Willing to travel as needed.     At least 3 years in a client-facing role.     Minimum 5 years managing client relationships in design and construction.     Excellent communication skills.     Effective decision-making and problem-solving abilities.     Proven team efficiency improvement and system creation skills.     Experience in high-growth, fast-paced environments.     Preferred experience with Fortune 500 companies.     Knowledge of project budgeting and scheduling.     Self-directed with a strong initiative and willingness to learn.

column2: We are looking for a        Civil Package Manager    to join our high-growth company that puts its people first Why join us           This is an exciting opportunity to join a high-growth company with a strong vision to accelerate the green transition. We support worldwide leading developers, asset owners, and technology companies within origination, modelling, development, construction, and performance optimization of Onshore/Offshore Wind, Solar, PtX, and Storage projects.            How will you contribute to our team            As Civil Package Manager, you will contribute to developing onshore facilities such as Onshore Wind and Solar globally. To be successful in this role, you will advance key development milestones and obtain approvals for the Civil Engineering related Scope of the projects which covers Foundations, Roads, Collection systems, Over head line and all related scopes.              About the Job          Major Tasks Responsibilities      Your accountabilities are likely to vary, but your main tasks will include the following:            Interface Management: Coordinating and managing workstreams related to Civil scope in the project development and interacting with internal teams and external consultants/advisors both internally and externally.      Project Optimization: Collaborate with business case modelling and engineering teams to refine project specifications.      Proposal and Commercial Opportunities: Technical support for proposal submissions, grant applications, and other commercial opportunities forwarded by our clients.      Product Development: Coordination of technical development of generating assets (Onshore Wind and Solar) for Red Flag evaluation, Due Diligence, feasibility studies, Conceptual Design, Detail Design, and Issue for Construction.      Project Development: Interacting with our development managers who are responsible for developing PtX Facilities or generating assets site and providing required technical support for development of civil infrastuctures for projects.      Construction Development: Interacting with construction management department and providing technical support during construction management activities.        About You            Like the rest of us, you are passionate about developing renewable energy, and you thrive in an international, multicultural environment where agility, flexibility, and adaptability are vital drivers.          You are open-minded, willing to adapt to a changing environment, and set the bar high when creating results. You have a passion for learning, a determined attitude, patience to educate others, and a team-first mentality.          With the right balance of professional skills and a personal mindset, you will get a unique opportunity to grow and develop with our team.            Required Qualifications            We expect you to enrich our business with the following qualifications and experience:              Bachelors degree or masters degree in an Civil Engineering discipline      Experience in the development of generating assets like onshore wind farm or Solar Farm and involved in construction projects.      Experience in the energy sector      Strong abilities to navigate and coordinate workstreams internally.      Have a strong track record with client interaction.      Outstanding communicator both with internal and external stakeholders
column11: Project development, Due diligence, Construction, Renewable energy, Performance optimization, Client interaction, Construction management, Business case, Technical support, Civil engineering

column2: PriMove Infrastructure Development Consultants Pvt. Ltd. is looking for Water Conservation Expert to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Education:    Graduate or Post Graduate in Civil / Environmental Engineering                  ?       Experience:    Minimum 15 years experience in Watershed Management / Ground Water Resource Management, implementation of Soil and Water Conservation Structures, knowledge of ongoing Government (GoM & GoI) schemes run by Soil and Water Conservation Expert      ?       Tasks         Assessment and Analysis: Conduct assessments of water usage patterns and identify opportunities for conservation and efficiency improvements. Analyze water consumption data, infrastructure, and practices to identify areas of waste and inefficiency.     Development of Conservation Strategies: Develop comprehensive water conservation strategies and action plans tailored to the specific needs and challenges of different sectors, including residential, commercial, industrial, agricultural, and municipal. Identify priority areas for intervention and set achievable conservation targets.     Public Awareness and Education: Raise awareness about the importance of water conservation and the benefits of sustainable water management practices. Develop educational materials, campaigns, and outreach initiatives to engage and empower individuals, communities, businesses, and organizations to adopt water-saving behaviors and technologies.     Policy Development and Advocacy: Advocate for the development and implementation of policies, regulations, and incentives to support water conservation efforts at the local, regional, and national levels. Collaborate with policymakers, government agencies, NGOs, and other stakeholders to promote the adoption of water-efficient practices and technologies.     Technology and Innovation: Stay informed about emerging technologies, innovations, and best practices in water conservation and efficiency. Evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of new technologies such as water-saving devices, efficient irrigation systems, and wastewater reuse technologies, and promote their adoption where appropriate.     Water Audits and Efficiency Assessments: Conduct water audits and efficiency assessments for residential, commercial, and industrial facilities to identify opportunities for water savings and efficiency improvements. Provide recommendations for upgrading infrastructure, retrofitting equipment, and implementing water-saving measures.

column2: Commission Management, to include:      Assisting on feasibility studies and writing procurement reports      Estimating and cost planning to include producing and presenting the final cost plan      Tendering and procuring, including managing the prequalification stage, producing the tender list, putting the preliminaries together, tender analysis, producing the tender report and compiling the contractual documents      Dealing effectively with post contract cost variances and the change control processes, where applicable referring major changes to line manager      Taking personal responsibility for making cost checks and carrying out valuations on larger projects and in all cases ensuring that timely and accurate cost checking and valuation takes place      Producing monthly post contract cost reports and presenting them to the client      Inputting into value engineering      Negotiating and agreeing final accounts      Interfacing with the client and other consultants, at all project stages      Where appropriate, leading a cost management team, ensuring that they deliver on all of the above accountabilities      Involved in the complete lifecycle of the project.      Supporting technical design briefs, analyse designs, and coordinate with multiple vendors.      Review Civil related specifications, interpret contracts, and participate in technical & commercial negotiations with vendors.      Lead a team & be able to supervise & coordinate onsite Civil construction activities.      Review/analyse and re-design all Civil drawings & material schedules with involvement in supervision of the site activities and to control cost and ensure timely completion of the project.      Co-ordinate all electro-mechanical activities with client, consultant, suppliers, site engineers & various subcontractors at site. Checking and preparing VO, negotiation with Sub-con and Client.      Provide interpretations of plans, project scope, detail sheets, and specifications for our civil related contractors/ sub-contractors and engineers to ensure a comprehensive and mutual understanding of the project plan.      Marketing and business development, to include:      Identifying opportunities to develop new business with existing clients and reporting such opportunities to the appropriate line manager and by making effective use of the marketing database      Assisting in the production of bid documentation      Identifying ways in which cost management procedures, templates and products can be improved and referring ideas to the appropriate line manager      Understanding the Turner & Townsend 2+2=5 philosophy and identifying cross-divisional opportunities      Internal management accountabilities, to include:      Knowledge management - Ensuring that key information and learning generated from each commission is input into the Turner & Townsend internal database      Financial management - Utilising FMS in order to keep track of the ongoing margin levels      Process improvement - Identifying ways in which internal systems and processes can be improved and referring ideas to the appropriate line manager      Key Performance Indicators      A Cost Manager will in part be assessed by the extent to which:      Commissions are managed to the right quality standards and are completed efficiently and on time      Service delivery on commissions is in line with the conditions of appointment      Good relationships are developed with clients and members of the cross-functional team      They work as an effective member of the cost management team, including where appropriate, taking effective responsibility for Assistant Cost Managers      Opportunities are identified to develop new business with existing clients      Margin levels are kept track of on all commissions      Key information and data is effectively cascaded and appropriately retained Environment Policy Should adhere to the company s global environmental policy       Qualifications            Education - Diploma/B.E/B.Tech (Civil)      You should have relevant experience of working preferably for a construction consultancy in India/abroad, hold a graduate degree preferably in Cost Management

column2: Responsible for managing the construction delivery of MEP services on projects to the agreed outcomes for time, budget, safety and quality requirements. Liaises and coordinates with key project stakeholders, forming strong working relationships with the client, consultants, trade contractors and other team leaders.             Leads the deployment of project strategic plans in conjunction with the Mace operating framework and strategic priorities, such as Prefabrication (C2P), Commissioning and Safety. Review issues to drive continuous improvement and provide lessons learned through the knowledge share process.              Works collaboratively towards the common goal of net zero carbon transition and share responsibility for the proactive identification and management of the associated carbon emissions and reductions during the delivery of work. column2: Safety first - Going home safe and well:                You will be a leading advocate of Maces value of Safety First, and be accountable for leading and maintaining exceptional safety, quality, cost, programme, sustainability and project compliance standards.              You will possess advanced technical expertise in local Health and Safety rules and regulations relevant to project portfolio.            You will champion a diverse and inclusive working environment, and understand the importance of the wellbeing of the people you manage.              Client focus - Deliver on our promise:                You will manage the delivery of key assignments and defined business areas, providing strategic direction and monitoring delivery aligned with overall vision and objectives. The candidate would join the operational team in the site management of large photovoltaic plant portfolios managed by WiseEnergy on behalf of primary investors and financial institutions at national and international levels. The role allows significant exposure to both senior team members and external Clients.                           KEY RESPONSIBILITIES                                         Perform site visits in a timely manner, in compliance with Construction and Asset Management agreements provisions and HSE rules                             Ensure quality control and quality assurance for sites under construction and operation                     Ensure site visit reports are drafted and submitted accurately and in a timely fashion                     Proactively ensure all issues reported from site visits are managed to a swift resolution                     Ensure optimal PR/ availability per asset                      Ensure all OM and EPC providers achieve, at a minimum, their contractual obligations               Ensure the conditions of the plants are compliant with HSE rules and provisions             Use insights and analysis of operations variables to generate an Annual Performance Optimization Plan reinforced with the use of cutting-edge technologies (to drive innovation)             Ensure 100% security of all assets including full availability of CCTV systems (if applicable)             Act as the representative of the PDT and technical asset management service to all existing and prospective clients             Lead on specific technical failures of the main components             Supervise the punch list works before and after plant acquisitions, and under construction             Work with third-party vendors to support project components (trackers, inverters, balance of plant equipment) installation, commissioning, testing, troubleshooting and maintenance             Troubleshoot and perform tracker and mechanical equipment maintenance             Communicate effectively with third-party vendors and actively participate in meeting reviews to provide technical feedback about filed operations and construction             Attend periodical meetings with the Technical Team at WiseEnergy offices.                           SKILLS COMPETENCIES                                   To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:                                         Time management prioritization skills           - things can get a little hectic, so the ability to effectively manage yourself and your workload is critical                           Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (in English or/and other European languages) -            you must be able to organize your thoughts in a way that others find clear and compelling. You will be expected to together well-written, grammatically correct emails and other communications. When communicating verbally - whether over the phone, on video calls, in person or in meetings - you will need to be articulate, warm and engaging                           Flexibility           - being an effective team player means being flexible in your approach and open to getting involved with new things, even if they are not spelt out in your job description                           Intellectual Curiosity -           we are looking for someone who is truly interested in our profession and has the intellectual curiosity to delve deep into topics and bring fresh ideas to the team                           IT Literacy           - you need to be comfortable with IT systems and working with data (you should have at least intermediate-level excel)                           Delivery focus           - it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters                           Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills                             Passion for our mission           to generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy                           Our values:            be a leader, build trust, be responsible, be innovative and bring your alpha .                                     EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS                                             Comprehensive knowledge of the technical characteristics of PV plants                     Knowledge of the management of PV portfolios                      Experience in construction/maintenance of utility-scale solar parks, most preferably as Site/Construction Manager/OM Coordinator                     Good knowledge of the UK technical and HS legislation applied to PV plants               Bachelor s degree in Engineering, preferably in Electrical Engineering or Electronics, or qualified to the same level through experience of other qualifications               The right to work in Poland.                                     WHAT WE OFFER                                         A busy role in a supportive team, with plenty of opportunities to learn                         International scope - we operate in over 8 countries                     Healthcare for you                 Annual discretionary bonus.

column2: Job Title:    Contract Billing Manager Position Overview:  As a Contract Billing Manager you will be responsible for managing the contract billing process from start to finish. You will work closely with our design team, project managers, and clients to ensure accurate and timely billing, while also maintaining compliance with contract terms and regulations. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of contract billing principles, excellent communication skills, and a commitment to delivering exceptional service to our clients. Responsibilities: Review      client contracts and agreements to understand billing terms, milestones,      and requirements. Collaborate      with project managers and design teams to ensure accurate tracking of      billable hours, expenses, and project costs. Generate      and distribute invoices to clients in accordance with contract terms and      billing schedules. Monitor      contract milestones and deliverables to ensure timely and accurate      billing. Investigate      and resolve billing inquiries and discrepancies in a timely and      professional manner. Maintain      accurate and up-to-date billing records, including contract documentation,      billing schedules, and client communications. Prepare      regular reports on contract billing activity, aging receivables, and other      relevant metrics for management review. Stay      informed about industry regulations, standards, and best practices related      to contract billing and invoicing. Identify      opportunities to streamline and improve the contract billing process,      implementing best practices and efficiencies where possible. Qualifications: Bachelor's      degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or a related      field. Minimum      of 8 years of experience in contract billing, invoicing, or accounts      receivable management, preferably in the interior design or construction      industry. Strong      understanding of contract terms, billing principles, and regulatory      requirements. Excellent      attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record-keeping. Proficiency      in accounting software and billing systems (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP, or      similar). Exceptional      communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact      effectively with clients and internal stakeholders. Ability      to prioritize tasks, manage multiple deadlines, and work efficiently in a      fast-paced environment. Strong      analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive and      solution-oriented mindset. Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

You must also be      prepared to be flexible in your approach to work and able to work in a wide range of team      environments. Your team-centric focus will ensure that you build and maintain strong working      relationships.                   Responsibilities:                   Reporting to the Director and Vice Chairperson, the position will be responsible for the      smooth running of project proposal submission and contracting-related operations. The Proposal and      Contracts Manager must be articulate and a strategic planner with practical time management skills.                   Key responsibilities are:                   Responsible for implementation of project bid/ proposal submission and contract-related      processes, including...                 1.         Assessment/management of project risks and coordination with stakeholders.           2.         Cost and fee build-up for grants and projects at bid as well as implementation stages.           3.         Monitoring     actual     progress     vs     financial     progress on     all    the    projects.     Monitoring frequency of invoicing.           4.         Review and approvals of Contracts, Work Orders, EoIs, contract extension      requests, variations, RFPs, RFQs, Sub-consultants agreements, change requests,      etc, for all fee and grant projects.           5.         Creation of contracts/agreements/MoUs for services as and when required      based upon the established processes.           6.         Ownership of the Operational Policies and Processes (OPPs) with regular      revisions as and when directed by the management.           7.         Maintaining organized records with the help of the team.                   Collating and creating the first cut monthly report on Centers and Project related activities                   Reviewing and approving Sub-consultant contracts and Service Agreements.                   Deputising for the Director in meetings with clients and Centers               Regular liaising with the Center Heads and Center team members.               Provide strategic and tactical advice on bids and contracts to the Director.               Continuous improvement of Operating policy and processes through taking and      implementing feedback from the Centers.               Implementation and driving of MIS system for projects                       Knowledge and skills:                   Demonstrated knowledge of management of bids/proposals and contracts               Strong     communication     skills     with     experience     in     maintaining     effective     stakeholder      relationships               Excellent administrative and organizational skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks,      show good judgment and work to competing deadlines whilst maintaining a high level of      attention to detail               Expert     planning     and     organization     skills,     especially     in     the     successful     coordination     of      organization-wide participation in high-value and/or high-volume projects               High level of initiative, including a commitment to continuous improvement, efficiency, and      efficacy               Demonstrated capacity to evaluate and interpret complex rules, policies, guidelines, and      procedures               Proven ability to thrive in a flexible, changing, and fast-paced environment                   Desirable:                 Experience working in a consulting environment               Bachelors in Technology (with MBA preferred) or Graduate in Civil Engineering/Urban planning     / Urban design with an MBA degree.               Experience in reviewing and negotiating project agreements               Desirable:                       Experience working in a consulting environment               Bachelors in Technology (with MBA preferred) or Graduate in Civil Engineering/Urban planning     / Urban design with an MBA degree.               Experience in reviewing and negotiating project agreements

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Research and identify new business opportunities - including new markets, growth areas, trends, customers, partnerships, products, and services - or new ways of reaching existing markets Participate in the preparation and execution of Construction Principals for Quarterly Business Reviews Planning, coordination, and direction of all local (customer, supplier & internal) projects Provide ongoing progress updates on new business development activities and other key indicators to the REED management team. Forecast sales, develop out-of-the-box sales strategies/models and evaluate their effectiveness Evaluate customer's skills, and needs and build productive long-lasting relationships Travel throughout the territory and visit customers on a recurring basis. Maintain records of all sales leads and/or customer accounts Represent the brands during all customer and prospect interactions Educate customers on how products or services can benefit them financially and professionally Monitor the company's industry competitors, new products, and market conditions to meet personal and team sales targets Research accounts and generate or follow through sales leads attend meetings, sales events and training to keep abreast of the latest developments. Coordinate sales team by managing schedules, filing important documents and communicating relevant information Ensure the adequacy of sales-related equipment or material Respond to complaints from customers and give after-sales support when requested Store and sort financial and non-financial data in electronic form and present reports Handle the processing of all orders with accuracy and timeliness Inform clients of unforeseen delays or problems Monitor the team's progress, identify shortcomings and propose improvements Assist in the preparation and organizing of promotional material or events Ensure adherence to laws and policies Responsible for business development by establishing a relationship with System integrators, and EPC Contractors in all States of India. Supporting System Integrators with all technical aspects during Pre and Post-sales activity. Responsible for identifying Industrial Product Suppliers, Architects, and Electrical Consultants and working closely With them to reach industrial, and commercial leads. Interacting with state nodal agencies I.e. NREDCAP, TSREDCO for Tenders, Empanelment and understanding the latest developments. Scrutiny of tender documents and Attending Pre-Bidding meetings and Site surveys, Plant load calculations and preparation of BOQ & BOM, Evaluating tender documents, drawings, & schedules. Floating Enquiries to Suppliers/Manufactures, Comparison Studies based on suppliers Quotations Negotiations with suppliers on both technical and commercial aspects of the product. Preparing purchase requests by verifying the Qualifying Requirements. Purchase of tender documents from different boards by sent DD or by courier or by personnel Preparation of checklist after receiving the documents Preparation of EMD requests pursuing getting the EMD in time with finance dept. Preparation of Qualifying Requirements documents & other technical documents Based on Client budget constraints for any specific project, carrying out Value engineering studies Conducting Meetings with the CFT team, Making Pre-Qualification documents, and both standards as well project specific questionnaires Submission of Bids both Online (e-procurement) and Offline. Ensure quality of work in the plant from start to end. Preparation of statement of business availability by searching websites of different electricity boards. Preparation of price bid by preparing the costs with the latest rates Searching for any new tender, a new requirement from Govt.& Pvt parties.  Preparation of tenders. Processing of Vendor Registrations and e-tendering Complete correspondence on P.O., Payment, delivery and after-sales services Submission & release of bank Guarantee as and when due Arrangement of approval of technical drawing & designs Execution of orders viz., arranging stage inspections, final inspections etc. Making schedule-wise dispatch programmed within the delivery date Ensure timely delivery & timely submission of the bill Drafting correspondence to customers  Understand the technical requirements and satisfaction of the customer by providing data in time Reporting and filing of activities Making MIS Report for Management as and when required  Desired Candidate Profile   We require candidates with good communication skills, who are self-motivated and with a high level of confidence.
